intro: Prasophyllum helophilum, commonly known as the sun-leaf orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to Australia. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its unique floral structure and specialized growth habits. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats, often in coastal or inland regions. Its flowers are usually green or yellowish, with a distinctive three-lobed lip that aids in pollination by specific insect species. Prasophyllum helophilum is a short-lived perennial, often found in disturbed or nutrient-poor environments.
